thread.title: Don’t ridicule me, Atiku’s wife tells lawyer
thread.title_full: Don’t ridicule me, Atiku’s wife tells lawyer

author: Zovoe Jonathan
title: Don’t ridicule me, Atiku’s wife tells lawyer
text:
Tweet 
Oluwatosin Omojuyigbe 
The wife of a former Nigeria’s Vice-President, Mrs. Titi Atiku, told a lawyer on Tuesday not to ridicule her. 
Atike appeared on Tuesday before the Lagos State High Court in Ikeja as a witness for the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission in an alleged N918m fraud. 
The defendants in the case are an ex-governorship aspirant in Akwa Ibom State, Asikakabasi Jacobs, Abdulmalik Ibrahim and Dana Motors Nigeria Limited. 
The defendants are being prosecuted by the EFCC for allegedly defrauding a company THA Shipping Maritime Services Ltd, where Titi had a share. 
While being cross-examined on Tuesday by the defence counsel, Mr. Charles Musa, Atiku had been asked if she would describe herself as a reliable person, after using different names on documents tendered to the court to prove her case. 
A displeased Atiku said, “I will not agree with you, I am Florence, I’m Doregos, I’m Titi, I’m Amina, I bear all the names. You cannot come and ridicule me here; I will not have you do that to me! These two gentlemen defrauded me and sold my property.” 
Earlier at the proceedings, the 3 rd defendant, who was not represented by any lawyer, told the court that he wanted to change his counsel because he suspected that his counsel had a cordial relationship with Atiku or had been bought by her.
